intro: Calyptridium nudum, commonly known as the naked calyptrid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, often hairy leaves and small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Calyptridium nudum is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
